intro: Androsace mariae var. tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan mouse ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
